results.description: This is a group interested in learning how to "make life happen," to be around people who demonstrate boldness and to be able to actualize, making your dreams a reality through meditation, healing and personal growth through creative connections. Looking forward to having you join us for our workshops, monthly meditation and many more events as you begin seeing transformation in your life.
results.name: Abington Spiritual Growth Meetup

topics.name: Meetings other couples who share your interest too

results.description: Interested in making other couple friends and doing fun things like discovering new restaurants, going to museums, or other social activities? We moved to the area after our kids grew up, so we don't have the option of getting to know the parents of our kids' friends. If you're in the same boat (or even if you're not!) please join us. Open to suggestions on specific activities, but we also like kayaking, bicycling, live music and theater.
results.name: Cambridge Empty-Nester Couples

results.description:
This group is here to help OUT, Gay, Bi, Queer Men to Explore, Examine and Encourage Fatherhood in themselves and others. You might not be a parent at this moment, or ever, but maybe you want to explore a range of areas, from books about parenting, to volunteer opportunities, to simple hang-out nights where you and other GQ-MEF's can meet. I started this group because I've always been a DOG at heart, (Dad/Fatherhood Oriented Gay man), and want to meet other men with the same interests and enthusiasm. I look forward to exploring the options available in the adventure of Fatherhood and tapping the fun kid in us all.

** Please note this group is strictly for Men considering Fatherhood and/or Dads with children under the age of 18. We understand sometimes Dads with adult children will try to join, but this group is not focused on parent relationships with adult children. It's focused on any/all opportunities to parent the 0-18YO group.
results.name: Gay Men Exploring Fatherhood: Boston Region

results.description:
We are a group of enthusiastic makers based at the HATCH Makerspace run by the Watertown Free Public Library (WFPL) and located at the Arsenal Project. Your involvement in our group could include becoming a skill mentor to help others learn your area of expertise, becoming a space monitor to keep HATCH open as many hours as possible, or simply attending any of the events we host.

If you have skills you can share and have even 3-4 hours a month to give us, consider becoming a skill mentor. Timid about your skills? How about becoming a space monitor--just help us keep the doors open. If you're interested visit our website.


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lpFFkytgACM
results.name: Makers of HATCH Makerspace

results.description:
This group's for fans of the Smash Brother's Brawl mod: Project M, in the greater Boston area (or anyone visiting that's looking to play). Let's play!

How to install Project M: http://projectmirror.no-ip.org/

About Project M: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Project_M_(video_game)
results.name: Smash Brother's Project M Boston Area Meetup

results.description:
It's pretty straightforward, we're a group that likes to run and have fun!

The main event is our Run & Chug. We meet every Wednesday, 7:00 p.m. at a different bar in Boston, go for a run and then meet back at the bar to have fun! We'll also run a lot of the local races and organize weekend running events.

If you're in your 20-30's (or just think you can hang) with a fun and outgoing personality looking to meet new people then come join us!

All running paces are welcome! The emphasis is on making it back to the bar! Both competitive marathon runners and those just getting started can find someone to run with. Sometimes runners take shortcuts, which is fine. Many members have improved their distance and/or speed as a result of attending the group.

Whether you're new to the city or just want to escape the humdrum of everyday life, these Wednesday runs are a great way to unplug!

Check out our other locations! 

San Francisco: http://www.meetup.com/SF-Fun-Run/

New York: http://www.meetup.com/NYC-Fun-Run/

Portland: http://www.meetup.com/Portland-Fun-Run/

Philadelphia: http://www.meetup.com/Philly-Fun-Run/

San Diego: http://www.meetup.com/SD-Fun-Run/
results.name: Boston Fun Run

results.description: Come join us at Todos Dance & Fitness Studio in Natick at 677 Worcester Street (Rt. 9 West) for an evening of social dancing. The party takes place 7-10pm. The first hour will be a lesson in Cha Cha, followed by 2 hours of social dancing of every style. Admission is $15, but we do offer discounts for studio members, as well as members of MASSabda (proper ID is required). For more information, or to RSVP to this event, please give us a call at (508) 545-1447, or email us at todosstudio@gmail.com. For more information about our studio, please visit us at www.todosstudio.com! We look forward to seeing you!
results.name: Natick Social Dance Party!!!

topics.name: Eckhart Tolle The Power of Now

results.description:
Welcome! Think of this as your time with spirit. My name is Regina and, as a Medium and Channel, I offer you a connection with spirit. A connection that may help you find closure, healing, humor, strength and direction.

Mediumship - Participants come to connect with loved ones who have passed. Who will come through for you?
Channeling - I work from a conscious state and access higher realms by connecting with high-level guides and masters.  The currently scheduled series of events will be an interactive events during which I will describe my work, channel a teaching from Spirit and provide opportunity for participants to ask questions to Spirit concerning the teaching. 

Some events are  'gallery' group events. Spirit may address individual participants  and/or address the audience as a whole.  Other events are public with the opportunity to schedule private sessions.

I am blessed, grateful and truly excited to make this connection with you.
results.name: Eastern Massachusetts  Mediumship /Channeling Meetup

results.description: Welcome, so happy you have joined us here. This is a spot to for anyone who wants to learn about or share information on living a chemically reduced life. We will be sharing about Young Living Essential Oils and how our families and community use the oils in our daily lives. We’ll also share lifestyle, recipes and DIY ideas for living a more chemically reduced life. We will also share invitations to our area events that you can attend to explore chemically reduced living through the essential oils, clean cooking, make and takes and more.
results.name: Living A Chemically Reduced Life (Boston & North Shore)

results.description: This group is a place for engineers, architects and data scientists to meet and discuss cutting edge software and hardware technologies. We meet every two months in a stylish yet casual environment mixing presentations, open panel discussions, and workshops. The food for each event pays homage to a different culture that adds to the unique blend of people and flavors that make up New England.
results.name: New England Software Engineers

results.description:
My workshops are for poker players who want to learn more about cash game strategy.  I will discuss $1/2 No-Limit Hold Em live cash games - the most popular poker game in every casino!

We will be meeting in Cambridge on the Red Line, 2 blocks from the Kendall/MIT T-stop.  It is in a classroom setting for a small group of 6-9 people.

Topics will include:

position, calculating outs, pot odds, pre-flop and post-flop action, bet sizing, tells, bluffing/semi-bluffing, hand reading skills, probability, starting hands, selective aggression, 3-betting, check raising, implied odds, hand counterfeiting, slow playing, tilt control, bankroll management, and game selection/table selection/seat selection.

Please update your RSVP if you can't attend so that people from the waitlist can go.  After more than one no-show, you might be asked to leave the group.
results.name: Poker Workshops

results.description:
What we're about: Our group is about community building based on many of Charles Eisenstein's principles in "Sacred Economics". Anyone who is interested is welcome.  Here's a brief video on some of those principles: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EEZkQv25uEs

Who should join: Anyone interested in exploring these principles.  Our emphasis will be on discussion followed by actual action though.  Some activities may include getting involved in timebanking, freecycling, and other aspects of collaborative consumption.  We may do many Transition Movement type activities also: http://jptransition.org/

What members can expect of the group: Consistent, genuine, thoughtful discussion and action.

What we expect of members: To be interested, genuine, and productive when possible.
results.name: The Sacred Economics Meetup

topics.name: Public Speaking as a Means to Market your Business

results.description:
Who should join: Beginners to Advanced speakers interested in learning how to improve their public speaking for fun or professionally.  Reduce your fear and increase your confidence.  Practice or take our lessons for beginners classes.

Why  members should join: Learn the basics of public speaking, challenge your current skills to be a professional speaker or just to have fun & meet interesting people.  You will also be challenged to give more challenging types of speeches such as ice breakers, humorous and inspirational speeches.

What members can expect out of the group: We have a fast paced 1 hour Tuesday meeting packed with speeches from members as well as Table Topics where anyone is invited to speak on a suggested topic for 1-2 minutes to hone their ability to speak off the cuff. 

You can also take a Wednesday night Public Speaking Academy for Beginners class where you design the class by telling us what you want to learn! And there is video feedback as well.

Lead meetings and presentations at work, begin your path to being a better teacher or professional paid public speaker or simply be a better storyteller.

Tuesday 12pm meeting for members and guests. Wednesday night at 6pm is the Public Speaking Academy for Beginners Please visit for free! 

All are welcome.
results.name: Power Public Speaking

topics.name: Single Parents, Divorced Parents, Widowed Parents
Moms who need a night out!

results.description:
Group established on March 20, 2016  (First day of spring). 

Welcome to Good Vibe Tribe! I am a so glad you are here. I began this group to facilitate friendships between families and to create bonding opportunities for our boys through social outings and other activities that may facilitate lasting friendships. Our focus is families raising boys of color, ages 8-12 . Meet with other parents (biological, foster, adoptive, honorary, god-parents, grandparents, LGBT, interracial, blended) strongly interested in developing relationships with other families of color. We will share an appreciation for fostering a strong sense of self-awareness, self-confidence and self-esteem in our boys. Let's get together to discuss the joys and challenges of parenting, while also having fun and tons of adventures. 

We do not exclude sibling participation. However, the focus will be on our 8-12 year olds.

Please respect the age range, as we will focus on activities of strong interest to children in this social and academic demographic. 

 This group will also foster a sense of inclusion and community for our children who are attending less culturally diverse schools. )


Tracy
results.name: Good Vibe Tribe: Social Group for Young Boys of Color

results.description: This is a group for all LGBT tech workers in the Boston area: devs, designers, IT, operations, you name it. We meet to swap stories, network, discuss issues, and share tech experience. All languages and orientations welcome!
results.name: Boston Gay Software Developers

results.description: More cat than dog? More Daria than Quinn? Prefer a solo trip to a quiet museum to a group-trip to the loud mall? If you're that mom/dad at the typical playdate standing in the corner, reading a book, etc. thinking "Oh boy, what did I get myself into", you belong here. Our babies/toddler/kids can play together while we either talk, (or don't!) We're not antisocial, but feel more comfortable on our own. Our kids may not be introverts themselves, so we generally agree that it's good for them to socialize and play with others if they want to. We can meet at Boston/Metro-West area parks, libraries, kids’ play areas, and attend free events, do arts and crafts, etc. If we feel like socializing with no pressure to be super-outgoing, we can have parents’-night-outs too. So... if you want to join a parent's group, but dread the inevitable small talk, gossip, etc. If you want a fellow parent to talk to for some support, but don’t feel like having to be ultra-social on a continuing basis, or if you ever feel judged or out of place a standard parents'/playgroups… This group is for you. ALL are welcome. Discrimination/hate of any parenting choice or lifestyle will not be tolerated, (everyone is safe here.)
results.name: Metro-Boston Introvert Parents

results.description: If you are technical and manage developers (or would like to), join us to learn from and connect with your peers. The Boston CTO School is part of an international network of CTO schools, clubs and summits designed to create communities to share proven best practices in engineering leadership.

Ideas can be submitted by any member of the South Shore Innovation community who wants to learn through discussion. That means you! If you want an expert to join us, let us know that, too.

results.description:
We are the original Lunedi' Italiano group originally started by Jessica Dello Russo, myself, and some other friends around 2001-02. 

PURPOSE: our goal is to have a non-profit, non-dues paying group that meets every two weeks, on every other Monday in Central Square (Andala Cafe) at 8:15PM, amplifying the more novice spin-off group that meets at 7PM.

WHO SHOULD JOIN: People with some conversational ability in Italian who want to improve it should join. The Cambridge meetup tends to be somewhat conversationally more advanced, but we will help you especially if you ask, we don't want to step on any toes. So if you want to get beyond menu's and what you like and don't like, and talk about current events, emotions, politics, history, art, music,sports all in Italian, - this is what will happen.

WHY? You should join because you already have at least a minimally functional ability to conjugate Italian sentences, and are looking to exercise and expand that ability, and hear native or near-native speakers.

BELOW: "FAGIOLI CITTA' " is Italian for 'beans city' - thus Boston's nickname, 'bean town'.
results.name: Lunedi' Italiano Boston/Cambridge

results.description: This is a group for anyone interested in attending DevOps Meetups North of Boston. We are passionate about continuous delivery, lean, infrastructure automation, configuration management, quality engineering, development tools, technology and just about anything you can code. Since it can be tough to attend Meetups in Boston when you live North of Boston we wanted to create our own.

results.description:
Launch It empowers product teams by sharing the product management, design, and UX processes to succeed.

The Launch It series is a monthly event hosted by Perfetti Media. The event provides teams with the techniques to deliver products users will love. Each event will include in-depth presentations along with a networking reception.

In this presentation series, you will learn the secret practices of some of the most successful product teams. Topics include launching your startup, methods for brainstorming product concepts, customer onboarding improvements, product visioning techniques, user research best practices, customer journey mapping, design ideation, and product evaluation methods.
results.name: Launch It: Delivering best-in-class products

results.description:
Welcome to BATSA, the Boston Area Talent Sourcing Association! Everything we offer in terms of sourcing education is free (with the generous support of our sponsors, but they do not influence our content - see our mission statement).

But that also means we depend greatly on the time/effort of volunteers. Regardless of what level of industry expertise you have, if you want to help us take it to the next level, we highly encourage you to learn about the various ways you can get involved, either as a volunteer or a cash or in-kind co-sponsor. You will benefit from being involved with this dynamic community of hundreds (so far!) of local, forward-thinking sourcers.

Ways to interact (all are free unless indicated otherwise): Latest News & Resources   

See highlights from past events

Join the discussions and get updates on our Facebook group

Join our Google group

Follow us on Twitter

Visit our official website at www.batsa.us for more.

results.description: The UX Lab is a group for anyone interested in strengthening their user experience design skills. The group was started in NYC and is now expanding out to build more like-minded communities. We want to meet other UX designers and create a lab-like environment where we could bring our works-in-progress and help each other brainstorm, prototype, learn how to use various tools/software, perform some usability testing and get/give feedback. Let's hone our craft by getting together and practicing good UX design :)

results.description: Whether you join us for your first 5K or 20th half marathon, whether you're crushing PRs or walking with friends, our goal is to make sure you have a Wicked Fun Running experience. We partner with sponsors and vendors who share our commitment to healthy lifestyles, charitable giving, community involvement, friendly competition and having Wicked Fun. Each Wicked Fun Running Event offers - USATF sanctioning ensuring rules and regulations of the sport and providing a safe environment for participants and spectators - A road or trail route that is tested and pre-approved by our team of experienced runners - Discounted youth entry fees - Timely awards ceremonies and great prizes - Great music to inspire you as you pump up, cross the finish line, revel in your achievements and cheer on friends - An after-party to celebrate all who ran, walked, and volunteered and made it Wicked Fun
results.name: Wicked Fun Running Events

results.description: This Meetup group will have one goal: Bringing people in Boston together for shared outdoor experiences, and the occasional happy hour! Our group will mainly be in the 18 to mid 30's age range but we are open! This will be a very active group and include: Running, Yoga, Mountain Biking, Rock Climbing, Skiing, Snowboarding, Drinking Beer, Socializing, Trail Running, Hiking and..well you get the point, anything adventurous and outdoors.  We will be cross-posting on other networks in order make the most of our time outdoors! Excited to meet you all!!

results.description:
Boston's transportation system based on 100+ year old technologies such as trains, subways, buses, bikes, and cars. Our system is slow, congested, inconvenient, unreliable, dirty, and inefficient.  We look to change that.  

This group will look at various options and plans for improving the transit system in and around Boston. We hope to come up with a viable options that will both help commuters and businesses as well as hosting large events such as the Olympics. I'm certain that real transit innovations will need to come from outside the status quo. If not us, then who?

Group's link: http://www.meetup.com/New-Transit-Solutions-for-Boston/

Our meetings will usually be at the MS NERD center at One Memorial Drive, Cambridge, MA.
results.name: New Transit Solutions for Boston

results.description: The Nor'easters is the New England chapter of the Association of Proposal Management Professionals (APMP). Through our affiliation with APMP, we seek to promote better business development and capture practices for our members' organizations, and to improve members' professional knowledge and skills. We serve proposal professionals in New England. Our members are employed in the commercial and government sectors and span a variety of industries. Some of us are new to proposal development, while others are seasoned pros. All of us, however, are interested in learning the latest advances in proposal development from like-minded peers and outside consultants. The chapter hosts several in-person and virtual events each year.
results.name: APMP Nor'easters - Advancing Proposal Management Practices

topics.name: MBTI INFJ INFP INTJ INTP ISFJ ISFP ISTJ ISTP HSP

results.description:
• Do you have an unquenchable thirst to know "what, why, and how", to the extent that you've spent hours on wikipedia? 

• Is one of your favorite past times meeting new interesting people? 

• Do you find yourself arguing from one position/perspective only to change to a completely different position mid-discussion? 

• Do you find most things humorous if viewed from the right angle? 

• Do you have a remarkable talent for procrastination? 

• Would you rather invent an automatic bill paying system than write a check? 

• Do you think this picture is amazing? http://sharpwriter.deviantart.com/art/Ben-Franklin-VS-Zeu... 

If so you might identify with the Myers Briggs type of ENTP http://www.16personalities.com/entp-personality. Or perhaps even if this doesn't sound like you, you enjoy the company of this particular brand of weirdo. In any case we would likely have a good time talking about this, that, and the other things.  All are welcome.    

We will keep a loose group structure with polls for activities, and a general focus on having a good time in whatever manner we choose. Some ideas are: cocktails and conversation, lectures then cocktails, cocktails then lectures, game nights, trivia, world domination, dancing, rock climbing, urban safaris, writing workshops, hackathons, etc, etc.   

We will attempt to cajole the INFJ (our supposed best buddies) meetup group into occasional dual events. 

Stop procrastinating and sign up!
results.name: Wild Speculation: ENTPs and Friends

results.description: We're a local group of knitters and crocheters who knit hats & scarves for Bread of Life, hats and mittens for Malden High day care, and blankets and shawls for Hospice Services in Everett. We're sponsored by First Lutheran Church in Malden; we knit as a spiritual practice to help out others, but we like to enjoy each other's company with beer or wine while we do so. Join us, and we'll give you a kit and pointers (if you need them) to get you started.

results.description:
Get a total body workout to tone, shape and lengthen your body in all the right places. 

PILATES, BALLET AND YOGA ALL IN ONE!

Tone it up...in all the right places! If a smaller, flatter waist, firmed, thinner thighs and a round, high booty sound good to you, then this class is for you. A combination of basic Pilates mat exercises and fundamental ballet and toning moves finished off with some Yoga/stretching to give you the lean, toned look you want without the bulk.

NO EXPERIENCE NECESSARY
OPEN TO THE PUBLIC

results.description:
Greetings!

This group was formed to bring new friends together who believe that exercise doesn't have to be like a thousand tiny deaths from boredom. We aim to create activities where we can get together to be active. Whether just starting out in a healthier lifestyle, or looking to maintain healthy exercise, we welcome all those who enjoy cammeraderie and motivation to get and stay physically active. We can come together at various venues including local parks and recreational areas to enjoy physical activity such as walking, scenic hiking, bicycle riding, or playing catch with footballs, basketballs, baseballs, frisbees etc., and other fun activities. The ultimate goal here is to become regularly active and as an overall result, healthier. 

Some activities could be special events like dancing, stand-up paddle boarding and Tai Chi classes, or rollerblading/skating at a local rink, or perhaps kite flying at a festival.  Other active adventures could include sea and pond/lake swimming, camping, birdwatching/ nature photo walks, star walks, apple picking, joining organized walks for causes and pet walking groups. 

We always welcome suggestions and feedback from our members on how we can stay active without it being a painfully dull routine. 

All ages, genders, social status and activity levels welcome. Let's get together and help motivate each other through fun and physical activity. Life can be better by being active together!

Best Regards, Andrew D.
results.name: Fun and Fit Club

results.description: This group is for anyone in the real estate community that wants to connect and discuss business solutions. We'll also discuss Marketing, strategies,business development and how to get started in real estate investing.

About the Founder

Wankyu is a writer for Blizzplanet.com since 2014. Attended PAX East 2015 as press, and  he was invited by Blizzard Entertainment to attend a private party to play the Hearthstone: Blackrock Mountain adventure.

After talking one-on-one with Eric Dodds and Yong Woo about firesides, Wankyu felt excited and decided to launch a Boston Fireside Gathering.

results.description:
This group is for anyone who interested in networking, connecting, communicating and creating media collaboratively in the greater Somerville community. You will also stay up-to-date about different media production classes and events throughout the year. 

If you would like to register (which costs a fee) for some of our media education classes there are two different rates. One is a member rate and the other is a non-member rate. If you live in Somerville, MA, you can join SCATV as an Equipment Member or Organizational member (if you have a community group or non-profit) and can take our classes at the member rate, and once certified you can reserve our facilities/equipment at no additional cost. If you are not a resident, you can still take our classes but will be charged a rental fee if you wish to use our facilities/equipment after the class. However, you can join as an Equipment Member through an Organizational Membership but this requires you producing programs for that specific group. If you have any questions about membership, please contact us at 617.628.8826 or by email at membership@scatvsomerville.org*


Cheers and let's make media that matters!
results.name: Community Media Collaborative

results.description:
A meetup for people who think outside the box. Soapbox-free. Debate-free. Rant-free. Join us for intriguing, inspirational, mind-expanding conversations on a wide variety of topics.   

"Critical thinking is that mode of thinking — about any subject, content, or problem — in which the thinker improves the quality of his or her thinking by skillfully analyzing, assessing, and reconstructing it. Critical thinking is self-directed, self-disciplined, self-monitored, and self-corrective thinking. It presupposes assent to rigorous standards of excellence and mindful command of their use. It entails effective communication and problem-solving abilities, as well as a commitment to overcome our native egocentrism and sociocentrism."   The Critical Thinking Community
results.name: Up The Rabbit Hole:  Fun with Critical Thinking

results.description: This book club based in Jamaica Plain for those interested in discussing literature from a feminist perspective. This is a book club for those who enjoy reading and identify as a feminist (who doesn't?!). We will be discussing both fiction and non-fiction works that fall under one or more of the following categories: 1. Written by female authors 2. Feature strong female characters 3. Explore gender, sexuality, race, ethnicity, etc. 4. Advocate gender equality and social justice ALL GENDERS WELCOME! If you're interested please leave a comment!

results.description: This group is designed to educate the beginner to advanced Real Estate Investor, 5 Real Estate Strategies including how to Wholesale, Fix & Flip, Lease Options, Seller Financing and Straight Options. Time-tested Executable Step system that has helped 10's of thousands of people. We meet in various ways such as live workshops and webinars. We look forward to meeting you very soon!
results.name: Boston Real Estate Investing & Marketing Entrepreneurs

results.description:
Philosophic Perspectives is an internet radio show on the ArtistFirst Radio Network that explores interesting and unique perspectives that run the gamut of human experience, from the issues of everyday life to the greater controversies of the modern world. This Meetup site is a community of listeners and potential guests who enjoy (or crave!) philosophically oriented conversation. If you are interested in becoming a guest, the best place to start is by joining the Radio Roundtable Pool at the Social Philosophizers Club, from which members may be selected to participate in radio roundtable discussions. I am also seeking guests from a variety of quarters: authors, artists, filmmakers and others across multidisciplinary fields or genres; if you think you may be a candidate, please get in touch with me, or visit the Creativity Expo.

In addition to occasional get-togethers, members of this group will be regularly invited to join activities sponsored by the Social Philosophizers Club, which sponsors a range of philosophic and intellectual discussion, and cultural events.

Philosophic Perspectives is broadcast live on the first and third Wednesdays of each month, 10pm EST, and you can also download free podcasts of past shows. You can also listen to past shows on my YouTube channel.  Whether your interest is listening to stimulating conversations that challenge your philosophical perspectives, or you are seeking opportunities to participate in the broadcasts and/or discuss your work,  I hope that you join our community!

-– Arthur D. Schwartz, Organizer

Creativity Expo
Social Philosophizers Club
Philosophic Perspectives Radio Show
results.name: Philosophic Perspectives Radio Show

results.description:
This group is for WOMEN who love the outdoors, hike, bike, backpack, climb, walk and just enjoy being outside and enjoy the company of other women. 

We want to create a positive and non-competitive environment for all women to enjoy. 

The Nature Girls Meetup Group is intended to be a fun group for all members. Members join the group freely and can cancel membership at any time.

We are dedicated to outdoor activities combined with fun and laughter. Join us on our weekend and weekday outings of walking in local parks, hiking in the White Mountains, snowshoeing, kayaking, biking, rock climbing etc.. Our outings are NOT hard-core, elite level sporting events, but you do need to be in decent physical condition to participate.

We will practice responsible hiking and hike in smaller groups (max. 15) to limit the impact on nature. The smaller the group the less ground disturbance and noise we will create. Those who will pass through after us will be eternally grateful.

We will stick to the rule to take nothing but pictures and leave nothing but footprints. 

Suggestions for events are always welcome and encouraged, and all members are eligible to act as  Event Host for the Nature Girls after attending 3 events, and with the approval of Nature Girls organizers. 

Membership agreement, details and fine print:

NATURE GIRLS CODE OF CONDUCT AND DISCLAIMER: In order to participate in any Nature Girls activity, you acknowledge and agree that this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others. * You assume all risk associated with this activity. * You are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity. * In the event of a hiking event, you know and will follow the Hiker Responsibility Code described at hikesafe.com. * You release, hold harmless, and indemnify the leader(s) and all members of this group on the hike and others in the group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons. * The description of the event may contain some errors.  You acknowledge that this description is only a guide. * In the event of a hike, labels of "beginner", "intermediate", and "advance" are subjective and depend on the experience of the hiker.  Distance and elevation gained are only approximate.  GPS coordinates are approximate, best viewed using Google Maps. Car, cell phone, and handheld GPS'es vary in accuracy and may not correspond to the meetup location. * The equipment list is a requirement for participation.  If you do not have the required gear, you may not be able to participate. * If you sign up for the event, but change your mind, you must update your RSVP to NO.
results.name: Nature Girls

results.description: This is a group for young adults in their 20s and 30s who need some help making friends and meeting people. We will find a fun activity such as game nights or going out to dinner in or near Cambridge to meet and practice making conversation and participating in group activities. This group is meant for people who have deficits in their social skills and would like to improve these skills in a low-stress, comfortable environment with others who might struggle from the same issues. It is also open to those who feel they have no problems with social skills but would like to participate in our activities and be a good model for appropriate social skills for others. While we have fun engaging in activities, we will also be working on introducing ourselves and making small talk.

results.description:
More Joy Boston:

Joy is EMOTIONAL OXYGEN, we need it to breathe deeply, every day. So, you do not need to be on a joy diet!

Energize your love life, discover your life purpose, and experience them light each other up!

More Joy Boston is a community of allies who enjoy conscious, creative, and outrageously fun Meetups! Our programs include:

• Playshops, such as "The Fireball Playshops" - improv theater classes about healthy and fun dating & relationships, and "The Life Purpose Time Machine Playshop" - get in (the Time Machine) and "test drive" possible future paths

• Workshops, such as "Great Boundaries" - a serious AND playful journey about developing great personal boundaries (get better at saying "no" and saying "yes" to create your best life)!

• Dynamic speaking engagements on provocative topics, such as "More Joy: Love, Sex, and Life Purpose"

• Highly interactive game nights, such as "Joy Time," a.k.a. "Gotta' Get My Joy Time!"

• Out-of-the-box outdoor journeys, such as "Couples Teambuilding Adventures"


Personal Growth meets FUN! Most events will be held in Harvard Square. Join us!

1. Meet great people
2. Have much more fun than you think you'll have
3. Learn how to manifest more joy in your life, present and future (Joy is the Fountain of Youth)
4. Practice experiencing more joy in the moment (at our events) - expand your capacity for joy

Enjoy your journey more than ever before!


Daniel Phoenix, MA, received his Masters in Counseling Psychology from the California Institute of Integral Studies, and his Bachelors in Socio-Cultural Anthropology from Tufts University. He has been a speaker, workshop/seminar leader, and More Joy coach, since 1995. Daniel also loves scuba-diving and thunderstorms, but not at the same time.
results.name: More Joy Boston - Gotta' Get Our Joy Time

topics.name: Planetary and Human Shift in Consciousness

results.description:
The Oneness Blessing (also known as Deeksha which is Sanskrit for "blessing" or "benediction") is the transfer of intelligent sacred energy - Divine Grace - which causes the heart to flower, heals relationships, quiets the constant chatter of the mind, opens the door to higher states of awareness and initiates a process of permanent awakening into Oneness where there is no longer a sense of separation and personal suffering. All that remains is causeless love, joy and peace in the present moment.

We start the circle the Chakra Dhyana followed by the Oneness Blessings. We allow time for integration of the blessings and sharing.

The Chakra Dhyana is an ancient technique from Tibet and India. It helps to enliven kundalini, a latent spiritual energy which when awakened flows through the Chakras, opening up higher dimensions in human consciousness. The meditation helps to expand consciousness in a way which relaxes the mind, balances the emotions and rejuvenates the body. The meditation includes the chanting of powerful mantras, including the "bija mantras" (or seed sounds) for the chakras, and a visualization of kundalini energy as a golden fluid flowing into the chakras.
results.name: Natick Weekly Oneness Blessing Circle

results.description:
This training is useful if you want to memorize more easily or want to keep your brain active and your mind sharper. It’s useful for: actors, seniors, students, singers, presenters, business people, hobbyists, the absent minded and others. You’ll be surprised at how well you can memorize anything of any type and length including: names, faces, numbers, languages (foreign and English), speeches, presentations, scripture, facts, data, songs, product information and course work. You’ll learn various methods including the historic “memory palace”. And you will discover that memorizing can be an easy, creative and enjoyable process.

This is what one recent student has to say: “A remarkably useful program. One of the best presentations of memory related material I have seen. Neil’s presentations were a pleasure to be at. The methods really work and are very well thought through and presented in a very entertaining way.” Dr. Mark Kon, Professor of Mathematics, Boston University
results.name: Memory Training Meetup

results.description:
TeamAIDAsha is a beginner-friendly marathon/half-marathon training and fundraising program. We train runners for full or half marathon races (Marine Corps Marathon in DC or Baystate full/half marathon in Lowell), and runners raise funds for AID and Asha.

Who should join?

• Anyone from couch potatoes to experienced runners 

• Anyone looking for a challenging activity this summer

• Anyone looking to make a difference in the world

Membership benefits:

• Detailed 25-week training plan with group runs every Saturday (starting in April ) until race day (October)

• Coaching support, fundraising training, mentorship by alumni runners

• Entry into Marine Corps Marathon in DC (October) or Baystate full/half marathon in Lowell (October)

• Water support during group runs

• Social events and life-long friendships

About the TeamAIDAsha

This team is jointly organized by volunteers from the Boston/MIT chapters of Association for India's Development (AID) and Asha for Education. We have been running this program since 2003. We have trained hundreds of runners to complete their first marathon or half-marathon.  For more information please visit our website at: http://www.teamaidasha.org/information-session-materials.html

Lawyers make us do this :-).  By joining the TeamAIDAsha program and runs you are agreeing to our official waiver at: http://www.teamaidasha.org/waiver.html
results.name: TeamAIDAsha Marathon Training Program

results.description: Let's play at the beach! The assistant event organizers are Denise & Russ who are also avid surfers and ocean lovers.  Stacey, Denise & Russ are the 3 muskateers and are out there even in the winter or travel south to surf.  All 3 of them also love to snowboard, so feel free to add any ski or snowboard trips, even though Stacey is in Costa Rica most of the winter.

results.description: About NBWS: The National Black Women's Society (NBWS), formerly Young Black Women’s Society (NBWS), a 501(C) (3), membership based organization was founded on March 5, 2005 in Dorchester, Massachusetts. Five dynamic women of color recognized the absence of a Boston- based organization that offered young professional women of color the necessary platform for leadership and support to realize their full potential. Today it has emerged as the only leading organization in Boston that targets emerging women of color who are looking to develop their personal, professional and civic lives. We have hosted over 100 events and programs and impacted the lives of over 500 women through the years. We continue to use our leadership, creativity and influence to shine a positive light on women of color in this region and beyond.

results.description:
RELAXATION OF DUES POLICY:

Currently dues paying is voluntary. If you attend a meeting and like it, please pay our $12 annual dues so we can make sure Meetup keeps supporting us. Thank you.
Robin, co-coordinator

FOR NEWCOMERS: 

This group continues and expands upon a science lecture group that has met monthly since 1984. We will have general discussion over supper, followed by a lecture or book review by a member, followed by questions and discussion on the presentation. Anyone may volunteer a talk at a previous meeting or electronically (they should have attended at least once), as long as the group feels the topic is of general interest to members. Talks should be aimed at the non-specialized scientific listener, but may include some well-explained math, if the topic requires it (e.g., for physics or math topics). Speakers are encouraged to provide a copy of typed notes for each attendee at the meeting, especially if there are pictures, diagrams or math involved, and may also attach notes to the meeting announcement, which will be made available to members at least a week beforehand. Book reviews should not assume attendees have read the book, though they are invited to do so. Occasionally, a science-based science fiction book or film may be chosen for review. Book reviews may include selected readings aloud from the book by the presenter. Blackboards will not be available, and LCD displays will not be convenient (except for occasional photos), as attendees may sit at a long table.

Currently we are meeting at Four Burgers, 704 Mass Ave, Central Square, Cambridge, from 7-10 pm. The talk will begin about 8 pm. People may arrive as early as 6 pm and stay till at least 11 pm if they wish. Four Burgers features locally-sourced, grass-fed beef, vegetarian, turkey and wild salmon burgers.
results.name: Cambridge Science Meetup

results.description:
Calling all women who are currently trying to conceive!

I have developed this group especially for you.

Topics will be focused on teaching you everything you need to know to boost your fertility and increase your chances of getting pregnant.  Meetings will discuss topics such as:

• How to chart your menstrual cycle

• Natural ways to boost your fertility (foods, supplements/herbs, healing modalities, lifestyle choices)

• Identifying menstrual disorders that may be hindering fertility and what to do about them

• Mastering ovulation - everything you need to know about ovulation that will help you increase your chances of conceiving

• And so much more

It doesn't matter where you are on your journey to create a family, you will learn something new each and every time we meet, that will get you closer to conceiving.  I will be leading many of the sessions but I'll also be inviting guest speakers to offer up their fertility related expertise.

This is the go-to place to learn everything you need to know to get pregnant.  It's a safe, supportive, incredibly informative meeting.  It doesn't matter where you are in the process (just started trying, about to try IVF or have gone through several rounds of IVF) or what your circumstances (LGBTQ, single, advanced age), this is a judgement free zone and all are welcome.  I can't wait to meet you!
results.name: Cambridge Trying To Conceive Meetup

results.description: Hi to all women that are interested in developing bioinformatics tools. Try to answer to 2 easy questions to avoid misunderstandings: - why women? is because you hate men? - No, although men are weirds (kidding ... some of my best friends are men). It seems I am weird because I don't find women in this particular field of developing bioinformatics tools (see this, for instance: https://github.com/chapmanb/bcbio-nextgen#contributors. Only a few out of 23 contributors. And this is one of the most collaborative tools I know) - and ... why? maybe women don't want this ... - well, I want to know if that is true, or whether there is another cultural reason behind that. I can not find any reason why women wouldn't be interested in developing bioinformatics tools. If there is, maybe I find what it is and I can publish a Nature paper (kidding again ...) Another experience was the last hackathons of codeFest (http://www.open-bio.org/wiki/Codefest_2014), where only there were two women out of 60 people... I just don't believe that there are no more like me... I am weird but not because of working on this. So, please, if you are interested in learn how to develop tools in Bioinformatics, or you already do, but feel alone (kidding again) ... just join the meetup and help to increase woman population in this field. The idea of this group is to be a proxy to the developer community (for now men dominated) with the hope to get a great balance in the field (and hope one day this group disappears). Everybody knows that more diverse means more ... everything.
results.name: Cambridge Women BioInformatics Meetup

results.description: CEC Inc. is a donation-funded, non-profit organization dedicated to empower individuals to embrace, explore, experience and fulfill their true self and obtain inner happiness for the betterment of humanity, which ultimately opens the door to freedom and ignites a spiritual journey.
results.name: CEC Inc

results.description:
C-OFFICER BOSTON

C-Officer Boston is a group of executives — CTOs, CPOs, and CSOs — who gather monthly at Google Cambridge for engaging presentations, lively round-table discussions, and beer and food. This group gives C-level executives in the Greater Boston community — from companies with cap sizes ranging from $20M to $12B — the chance to interact with each other more frequently. You can participate as little or as much as you like, with no obligation to stay in the group if you don’t enjoy it.


The Home Bar of Google’s Boston Common offers an intimate, relaxed setting to get to know each other, with a private bartender serving ales, lagers, and homemade pizza and wings.


Each event offers the opportunity to hear from three speakers (VPs, directors, and/or engineers) who each deliver a 20-minute presentation on topics of interest to designers and developers. Don't miss this excellent opportunity to meet and mingle with top talent and experts in the field. There's absolutely no agenda or pressure — stay only as long you want!

To participate, simply create a Meetup account with an e-mail address and then join C-Officer Boston. As a member, you can RSVP for the monthly C Mixers, send messages to other executives in the group, and even schedule and host events of your own.


We're easy to find, just off the MIT T Stop on the Red Line.


We look forward to meeting you!
results.name: C-Officer Boston

results.description:
More Joy Singles (Boston-Cambridge):

Joy is EMOTIONAL OXYGEN, we need it to breathe deeply, every day.  As a single person, true joy is irresistible, so get off your joy diet!!

Energize your love life, discover your life purpose, and experience them light each other up!

More Joy Singles (Boston-Cambridge) is a community of allies who enjoy conscious, creative, and outrageously fun Meetups! Our programs include:

• Playshops, such as "The Fireball Playshops" - improv theater classes about healthy and fun dating & relationships, and "The Life Purpose Time Machine Playshop" - get in (the Time Machine) and "test drive" possible future paths

• Workshops, such as "Great Boundaries" - a serious AND playful journey about developing great personal boundaries (get better at saying "no" and saying "yes" to create your best life)!

• Dynamic speaking engagements on provocative topics, such as "More Joy: Love, Sex, and Life Purpose"

• Highly interactive game nights, such as "Joy Time," a.k.a. "Gotta' Get My Joy Time!"

• Out-of-the-box outdoor journeys, such as "The More Joy Singles Adventure Scavenger Hunt"


Most events will be held in Harvard Square. Join us!

1. Meet great people
2. Have much more fun than you think you'll have
3. Learn how to manifest more joy in your life, present and future (Joy is the Fountain of Youth)
4. Practice experiencing more joy in the moment (at our events) - expand your capacity for joy

True Joy is Irresistible!

Daniel Phoenix, MA, received his Masters in Counseling Psychology from the California Institute of Integral Studies, and his Bachelors in Socio-Cultural Anthropology from Tufts University. He has been a speaker, workshop/seminar leader, and More Joy coach, since 1995. Daniel also loves scuba-diving and thunderstorms, but not at the same time.

What is Couchbase?

Couchbase is the company behind Couchbase open source project, a vibrant community of developers and users of Couchbase document-oriented database technology. 

Couchbase Server is a packaged version of Couchbase technology that’s available in Community and Enterprise Editions. Couchbase is known for easy scalability, consistent high performance, 24x365 availability, and a flexible data model. 

Companies like AOL, Cisco, Concur, LinkedIn, Orbitz, Salesforce.com, Shuffle Master, Zynga and hundreds of others around the world use Couchbase Server for their interactive web and mobile applications.

Sign up to our Couchbase Developer Newsletter

results.description:
Circlesinging is a spontaneous, improvisational community-singing experience, a little bit like a "drum circle" for singers. In a Circlesong, a leader starts by improvising a line of music and gives it / teaches it to one part of the circle. The leader then develops a second part that goes with the first and gives that part to another section of the circle. Circlesingers learn and repeat the exact part given to them. Soon we are singing a four part (at least) chorus that has never been sung before. This chorus can support individual solos. 

The effect: never-before-sung, wordless, fun songs, melodies, harmonies, & rhythms. The music may be glorious or goofy, complex or simple. Each circle is a unique experience, created by a spontaneously collaborating community. 

This is a "mistake-free" zone, for all levels of singers  -  we sing for the sheer fun of it! Sing beautiful harmonies without sheet music. Witness a circle of people creating music together. Come sing with us! Participants find it a joyful, exhilarating (and many have said spiritual) experience. Improvising and music-making can give insight into other life issues. Many notice cooperation, teamwork, and community. 

We take inspiration from methods developed by the unique and illustrious Bobby McFerrin and his collaborators, and from Circlesinging groups in cities around the US and the world. 

More about Circlesinging: 

If you are new to Circlesinging, you can hear and see examples in the videos below: 

1 -   In the following video, Bobby McFerrin creates a Circlesong with audience members, then riffs on top of it. Start watching at minute 5:25 (through 9:30)  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WznXAdYo8xc 

2 -  Berklee faculty member Joey Blake leads students in Circlesinging, in this video starting at minute 1:28. You also see individuals improvising solos on top of what has been created so far. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GFHAf1vR9cE&list=P... 

3 -   In the following video, you come into a Circlesong in progress; two sections are already singing their newly created parts as the video begins ….. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=t6WL7NYrT9Q 

4 -  Starting at minute 2:00 in the following video, see Bobby McFerrin starting a circle (and see also his playfulness with audience members) https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PWriGiWw6i4&spfrel...

5 - Here's a fun one from the TV show "SingOff"  start at minute 1:00  the link is  

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TNlmU4nPySI&feature=youtu.be
results.name: Circlesinging Boston

results.description:
Join us for Feldenkrais Awareness Through Movement classes in various locations around the Merrimack Valley and northwest of Boston! Through guided attention and playful movements that recreate the way young children learn new motor skills, Feldenkrais Awareness Through Movement engages your whole self to explore the dynamic relationships in your body organization and provides a safe space to let go of habitual, often subconscious, tension patterns. Grounded in neuroscience, developmental psychology, and the physics of human movement, the Feldenkrais Method offers a direct and effective means to reduce unnecessary muscular effort and attain greater stamina and ease in all your physical activities. A regular Feldenkrais practice is great for improving coordination and flexibility, refining performance in your favorite athletic or artistic activities, as well as injury prevention and recovery.

"Make the impossible possible, the difficult easy, and the easy elegant." --Dr. Moshe Feldenkrais
results.name: Merrimack Valley Feldenkrais

Transform Your Business. Be Accountable for Results.

Our goal is to help you transform your business and get over your mental hurdles.  

If you want a serious mastermind group dedicated to solving your business problems, we are here. 

Mastermind Meetings

Intros: Share Big Win and Current Challenge

Hot Seat: Each session we'll meet in small groups where everyone will gets a chance to be on the "hot seat." 

On the hot seat, you will discuss a major challenge for no more than 2 minutes. The group will then engage you and provide feedback for 10 minutes. 

Next Steps: 

At the end, we take notes on everyone's next step and remind you via email between meetings. 

Workshops

Over the next 12 months, we will have workshops covering the following topics: Your first 100 customers, How to raise $500,000+ on Kickstarter, How to design your sales funnel, and How to sell $10,000+ via webinar.

We will help founders like you stay accountable and on track towards a great business.

New England Irish Set Dancers is a group for any and all who are interested in Irish Set Dancing. All skill levels are welcome. No partner needed. Set dancing is Irish folk dancing (social dancing) and is a fun way to exercise, socialize, and meet other Irish Set Dancers.  

Group leaders and dance instructors from various parts of New England started this group as a way to share their local set dancing events and class information with others who are looking to find locations to set dance or those who are interested in lessons. Dance locations are in the Greater Boston area of Massachusetts (including Wakefield and Quincy), Southern New Hampshire (Durham), and Rhode Island (Cranston). We welcome other set dancing groups / locations in the New England area to join as Organizers. [It is free for members to join; Organizers pay a fee that is shared by all locations.]

http://www.meetup.com/New-England-Irish-Set...

Get In2 Nature - Creative Fun 4 Grown-ups. Remember what it was like to be a free-range kid? We spent most of our play time outside. We used our imaginations, we were active, we explored, we made "stuff" in the woods and on the shore. ADULTS GET INTO NATURE MEETUPS are SUMMER CAMP ACTIVITIES 4 ADULTS. Whether we join together for easy trail hiking or biking, art activities or just silly stuff the meetups are sure to be fun and different (emphasize different). But you first have to join and then you have to show up and engage.

Scavenger hunts, archery, kite flying, painting & drawing, sandcastles, driftwood creatures, rock balancing, and much more await you. This is not a serious hiking group nor is it one that focuses on going out to eat and drink (though that might happen on occasion). The focus is on FRESH AIR & CREATIVE FUN OUTDOORS. So sign up! The more the merrier. Get your friends to join and make some new ones too.

Every grown-up is welcome to join but it is required that you to have a clear identifiable photo of yourself so that we can recognize you. And now for the DISCLAIMER: During all events, everyone is responsible for themselves. No organizers are responsible for the safety of the participants. By joining the group, you acknowledge this.
results.name: Adults Get Into Nature – New England

results.description: Hello ladies of Newton, Brookline, Watertown and Waltham! Are you interested in getting out more, trying new things, and socializing with other fun ladies nearby to where you live? This is the group for you! Types of activities include drinks, coffee, dinner, brunch, walking, culture, art, live music, trivia night, etc. I am starting this group to make it easier for ladies like myself to attend conveniently located Meetups -- and hopefully make new friends! Although Meetup locations are primarily in Newton, Brookline, Watertown and Waltham, all ladies are welcome to join!
results.name: Ladies of Newton, Brookline, Watertown and Waltham

results.description: Hey Boston hot moms, let's get together for our little ones - party, talking, playing, museums, outdoor/indoor, exploring.....we have so much to do to inspire, teach, and delight our babies. As a new mom, sharing, learning, and changing are the top three things that I always keep in mind. I know you agree with me!
results.name: hot mom Band - 辣妈帮

results.description:
We're a group of mobile app developers (iOS and Android), mobile startups, and mobile marketers interested in growing our apps. From organic growth hacking, to paid installs, to deep links and referral systems, we cover all things related to growth. Come hang out with us, listen to some great speakers, and learn from some incredible mobile growth experts. 

Stay up to date with the latest mobile growth tips:

Join The Mobile Growth Community Online | Join us on Facebook | Sign up for the blog | Check out videos from our past events

Mobile Growth Meetups are powered by Branch and Grow.Co.

Branch provides free deep linking technology to mobile app developers and marketers. We're on a mission to help you grow their business through deep linking, and allow users to discover content inside mobile apps. In 14 months Branch grew to a company with 50 employees and raised 18 million in funding. In the last year, Branch has gone from powering deep linking for 6 million users to more than 1 billion users.

Grow.co is a community of growth marketing professionals and brands, comprised of more than 7,000 acquisition and retention-oriented professionals. We serve the community through industry summits, a weekly newsletter, a jobs board, and an online forum.
results.name: Mobile Growth Boston

Do you have a clear strategy for your next non-profit career move?
Are you struggling with what sector to focus your limited time on to be most effective?
Have you found the job search a bit overwhelming on idealist.org? 
Are you looking for a new career system to help your search?

If you are looking to accelerate your career in nonprofits or with a social enterprise, then this is a great meetup for you.

results.description:
Boston Skeptics is a group of critical thinkers who get together to talk, eat, drink, and be skeptical about things like homeopathy, creationism, psychics, aliens, alternative medicine, conspiracy theories, and whatever else catches our attention.

We meet each month for "Skeptics in the Pub" (SitP) and feature a speaker or fun event centered around science, critical thinking, skepticism, etc. Our current venue for SitP is the third floor of Hong Kong in Harvard Square.

Our Book Club continues to meet monthly at the Harvard Northwest Building in room 169 (the doors are locked on the weekend but we put up post-its with a phone number to get access).

Drop by our website, Facebook account, etc. for more info, videos, and other content:

http://bostonskeptics.com/

https://www.facebook.com/groups/bostonskeptics/

https://twitter.com/bostonskeptics

https://vimeo.com/channels/bostonskeptics
results.name: Boston Skeptics

results.description:
Welcome!  We are a group of authentic movers, conscious dancers and JourneyDancers.  We come together to dance barefoot - to express, play, connect, heal and celebrate to all kinds of fabulous music.  We create a safe and joyful space that allows us to get barefoot and blissful, wild and peaceful.  JourneyDances are loosely guided as we follow and honor our body’s own intuitive movement.  We create a space for our minds to become quiet and clear and positive.  As we soften that mental energy, we can release the negativity and judgment that we sometimes carry and our capacity for compassion expands.  JourneyDance™ Conscious Dance Practice is a movement program open to everyone, regardless of physical ability, fitness or prior dance experience. 

This is a welcoming community of dancing souls!  Together we connect within ourselves open our hearts to connect with one another in joy and wholeness.

We begin by warming ourselves and grounding with the earth and establishing a deeper connection within our selves. This creates a foundation that supports our continuing journey to our fullest expression.  I hope you will join this radiant dance community and Dance Your Whole Being.  

We have monthly gatherings and classes at 3 studios on the North Shore:  Green Tea Yoga in Salem, Roots to Wings Yoga in Newbury, and Floating Lotus in Gloucester - on Friday and Saturday nights.  Check our calendar for exact dates and times.  And of course you can also keep informed about upcoming events on our Facebook page: EMBODYINGSOUL & JOURNEYDANCE.  

Visit www.embodyingsoul.com for more information and to register for classes. 

When we dance, our purpose is not to get to a certain place on the floor. It's to enjoy each step along the way.~ Wayne Dyer
results.name: JourneyDance & Conscious Movement

results.description: This is a group for people interested in catching some rays outside, and jamming together on some funky blues tunes, some bluesy funk tunes or even some toony funk blues.... whatever floats the collective boat of the group at the time of the jam. This group is intended for jammers of all skill levels who want to meet some new people and play fun stuff without having to read music or shred like Stevie Ray-Vaughan. If you enjoy The Grateful Dead, B.B. King, The Allman Brothers, String Cheese Incident, Buddy Guy, phish, Eric Clapton, and sitting outside with cool people, you will most likely enjoy this group. All instruments are welcome!
results.name: Outdoor Acoustic Jam Sauce Meetup

results.description: Group for mom who like to go out and have fun!
results.name: Boston Moms -20s and 30s

results.description: Yorkie playtime is the best time. Lets get our little ones together once or twice a week for some fun. We can meet in the Commons, little dog parks or the Esplanade to give them a little room to run. Open to ideas for good places.
results.name: Boston Yorkies

results.description: Calling all Nail Techs! This is a Group where Nail Techs, Nail tech students, Nail Instructors, and Salon owners can get together, have fun, network, and educate each other. This group will give professionals a chance to meet some nail talent in the city, and possibly do business with one another.
results.name: Boston Nailed It!

results.description:
Our vision is to use an entrepreneurial mindset to advance Asians across all levels of society. We are a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization that is dedicated to the promotion of entrepreneurship and the sustainability of the entrepreneurial culture within the Asian American community in Boston. 

    In America, Asians are vastly underrated and underrepresented in positions of power. We represent 5% of the American population, but only 1-2% of leadership positions in political offices, corporations, healthcare, academia and entrepreneurship.

     Eddie Huang, entrepreneur, writer, and chef, puts it well: “I don't think people understand the model-minority stereotype is negative. You are boxed in. You have to untangle that to find your own path.” With the creativity and passion associated with entrepreneurship, our mission is to help Asians break stereotypes, give Asians a voice and support the Asian community.

     We will reach our vision by connecting, educating, and giving back. Connect: To build connections and create a vibrant community of entrepreneurial-minded people. Educate: To promote learning and help Asians develop an entrepreneurial mindset. Give Back: To provide resources to support our Asian community Programs.

Examples of our programming include: • Leadership Series bringing in successful entrepreneurs to share their story • Monthly Leadership Development Workshops • Summer Entrepreneurship Program for High School students • Directory of Local Asian Entrepreneurs • Monthly Newsletters • Mixers for Entrepreneurs • Book Club focusing on biographies of entrepreneurs


Make sure to join our directory to stay abreast of events and updates!

http://goo.gl/forms/9a34j5a4uV
results.name: Boston Asian Entrepreneurship Foundation

results.description:
BGN.io is the monthly event that brings together Boston's innovation crowd for an evening of board games and great times. We're always looking for new players! 

All of our proceeds go to Resilient Coders, an awesome organization dedicated to making web tech education more available to urban youth who might not otherwise be exposed to it.
results.name: Boston Board Game Night . IO

results.description:
Are you a small business owner? Have you been reading the headlines about things like the Target data breach? This group is for Small and medium business security collobaration and discussion, with with security professionals and other small business owners to figure out what todays headlines mean to you!

Come meet with us over coffee or beer and talk with other small business owners and security gurus about what's important to pay attention to and what to do about it!
results.name: New England Small Business Security

results.description:
​We at the Cambridge Croquet Club strongly believe that one of the best ways to popularize croquet is to focus on youth development and community engagement. We have established several programs for collegiate croquet competitions which includes volunteer opportunities & charitable events. 

We are also organizing programs that makes the formation of High School croquet teams easy and inexpensive. We strongly believe that good physical condition helps in croquet as in all sports. The challenge of croquet is both mental and physical. ​We believe that you too will have a "Wicket" good time.  Any children present under the age of 18 at any Meetup event must be supervised by a parent or guardian.
results.name: Cambridge Croquet Club Meetup

results.description: This MEETUP site is primarily for all of the Northern Bristol, Northern Plymouth and nearby Norfolk counties members of the Southeastern Massachusetts Time Exchange and also for non-members who are interested in following it. This MeetUp site is a bulletin board for staying in touch and up to date about Exchange activities in your area. Membership in the Time Exchange is not a requirement for membership in this Meetup group. It is a sister site of South-Coast-Time-Exchangers and Cape-Cod-Time-Exchangers Meetup sites. Time Banking is a means to foster community and mutual aid in this disconnected world. If joining on our EXTERNAL WEBSITE, exchangetime.org, people list their Offers of and Requests for help. When you need help you look to see who is offering that service and get in touch with them. A person providing help gets to "bank" those hours and "spend" them getting someone else to help with whatever s/he needs. It's not direct swap and no goods are exchanged. Just TIME. The idea is to connect and help people through an "alternative" economy. We hold monthly get-togethers, often potlucks, and sometimes also gather at interesting local events. We did a Repair Cafe last summer and plan future Skill Share events. See also hourworld.org.
results.name: SOUTH OF BOSTON TIME EXCHANGERS

topics.name: Volunteering to end extreme poverty & hunger!

results.description: This group is to organize training rides for the upcoming Ride for Food (www.therideforfood.org) being held this upcoming September 25th in Dedham. The Ride for Food raises money and awareness for hunger relief in the greater Boston and Worcester areas, and this year will be working with 18 area organizations (http://www.threesquaresne.org/partners/). The practice rides tend to be in the 10-40 mile range with practice routes being announced closer to the date. The Ride routes can be found at http://www.threesquaresne.org/riders/course-maps/. Please join us for a fun ride.
results.name: Dedham - Training Rides - Ride for Food - All are Invited

results.description: We have been ventured to our local playground at Stoddard's Neck and we have met so many Great Dane Brothers and Sisters, we wanted to try and create a regular play schedule time. So that we can all meet up and have some great Dane Day fun.
results.name: HIngham/South Boston Great Dane Meetup

results.description:
This group is all about the future of transportation and the connected car. If you love cars (connected ones, autonomous ones, electric ones or even shared ones) this is the group for you. We are a group of tech and car enthusiasts who come together to share the biggest and brightest ideas and companies in the space. We host monthly meetups with some of the most progressive startups, entrepreneurs and companies in SF.

We hope you join us and look forward to meeting you all. If you're interested in any aspect of the connected car, please join us. We'll give you a warm welcome..
results.name: Connected Car Boston

results.description:
The goal of this Meetup is to bring the community together to apply data science to improve society.   Some areas that will be addressed include crime, healthcare, transportation, clean energy; income disparity, among others.

The key aspect of this group is that its primary goal is Social Impact.  It is very important that members who join have a strong personal interest and commitment to working on projects that involve social issues.   We will be having training on data science such that if you are a beginner then we will help you improve your skills; to then in turn help you apply this to solve problems.  We will also have events, such as hackathons, where seasoned data analysts and scientists can immediately apply their skills to social issues.

The group will seek to include folks from many different organizations (including government, non-profits, academic researchers, community organizers, corporations, startups) towards working together on initiatives.  Furthermore, there are several existing Meetup groups that are also focused on social impact (though with a different focus, such as Volunteering, Civic Hacking/Coding, Open Government, or the like).  We will look to partner across Meetup groups to bring all of our complementary skills together. 

At our initial meetings, members will help prioritize as to what types of event formats each would like whether hackathons, weekly get-togethers, et al.
results.name: Data Science for Social Good

results.description:
Welcome to the Waldorf Class of 2022 Meetup Group, a website for Waldorf School of Lexington 1st grade families in Ms. Voss' class. This group is designed to continue building our community through social interaction and play, volunteer opportunities that support class/school activities, and many other gatherings that will bring our families together in a supportive, friendly environment. This site will be especially useful during the summer months, when children will be enjoying activities away from school but may want to stay connected to school friends.

The site also includes a Discussion Board. Here you can post family-friendly comments, questions, lunch ideas, articles, etc. Feel free to start your own discussion or add to an existing thread.

To view upcoming gatherings, click on the Calendar button. You can then click on the event name for all the details and to RSVP. If you RSVP positively, you will receive several reminders leading up to the day of the event. An RSVP with regrets will automatically stop future notices regarding this particular event. If you prefer not to receive notices from Meetup informing you of an event, you can change your Meetup settings accordingly. 

The Waldorf Class of 2022 is set up so that anyone in the group can add an event. If you prefer, you can send me a note with the event details and I will gladly add it to the Meetup calendar. 

We hope you enjoy this convenient resource. Please call or send me a note if I can help in any way as you get familiar with the website.
results.name: Waldorf Class of 2022

results.description:
This group is for parents of children born in 2011 and 2012 who wish to meet other working moms and dads trying to balance family life and a career!  This group will allow our little ones to grow up together around similar aged friends.  We'll have affordable activities with our Preschoolers in our neighborhood, like going to story-time at the library, having picnics at the Park, play groups, outings, potlucks, book clubs, and many, many more wonderful activities throughout Boston and the surrounding suburbs. We can also have events for just moms / dads, like movies, dinner, and anything else that looks like fun!

Our group is an open forum, so everybody is welcome to initiate and organize their own events to add to our calendar. Let's get together :)
results.name: Working Parents of Preschoolers

results.description: This group is for people who care about unleashing and engaging the collective intelligence, adaptive capacity and creativity of their teams, organizations, Boards, community groups, etc. Liberating Structures is about action, engagement and collaborative change – practiced through 33 (and growing) easy-to-use, powerful, and continually adaptive group engagement “structures” designed to surface insights, ideate, identify best practices, strategize, or help people see what they can do to make change happen. This group will be focused on exploring Liberating Structures through practice (doing them at the Meetups) as well as sharing experience / knowledge about applying them in work contexts and by exploring opportunities for collaboration and projects. This group is open to anyone; no experience necessary, just a willingness to learn and share.
results.name: Boston Liberating Structures Meetup

results.description: “when you are facing in the right direction, all you have to do is keep on walking…” If you are looking for a group of like minded women that can inspire you to lead a healthy life, in harmony with yourself, others around you, and in nature, then this may be the group for you! This is a group for anyone who has searched high and low for a casual, non-judgmental, fun-filled environment to explore almost anything related to health, wellness, mindfulness, and balance of the mind, body, and spirit. Come join a gathering of women (aged 21+) who may engage in a group yoga or meditation class, share stories, decide to read a particular book of the month, go out dancing, find a crazy outdoor adventure, or simply offer a space to just "be". A place to feel inspired, an alternative to a coffee shop or bar, a community that perpetuates understanding and support. Sometimes we just need to be around other women who "get it"!
results.name: 20-30's Women! Summer Fun + Wellness, Somerville and Beyond

We edit photos live in a studio.
Photoshop classes are provided after every shoot.

results.name: North Shore Networking

results.description:
CIC: Community, Innovation, Collaboration. A community of hackers, inventors, artists, and makers. CIC is a community organization founded to support people from all walks of life in their endeavors to create lasting, innovative change. Events produced by CIC cover topics like art, sustainability, musical composition, 3D Printing, writing, DJing, and more. All topics are curated with a focus on forward-thinking designs and solutions, and all events are free and open to the public. The formats of our events vary from after-hours networking to walking exhibits, hands-on activities, creative workshops, and group discussions. As we grow, we will continue to broaden the scope of our event offerings. We are interested in asking tough questions, and in providing the local community with a unique physical space to collaborate on exceptional solutions. This is an exciting time for human civilization and for CIC. Join our group, attend our events, and experience it for yourself.


Please note: Our goal is to create an inclusive and supportive environment, and as such we follow the credo of our sister organization Venture Cafe http://vencaf.org/credo

We believe that innovation is a social process fueled by trust, collaboration, and storytelling, and we thus reserve the right to limit access to any individual at our discretion.
results.name: CIC Cambridge

results.description: WELCOME! This group started for Moola Mantra Month which is in May. Occasionally other chant opportunities will be scheduled. You can join like-mindful people, quiet your mind and raise your energy and the help raise the consciousness of our planet. All religions and no religion welcomed, no chanting experience necessary.

Grab your uke and join us for playing and singing along. We have varying levels of ability and we like a wide range of musical styles. We will meet in Sharon center, accessible on the Providence/Stoughton commuter rail line. There are about a dozen of us who have been meeting weekly since January 2015, and we'd like to meet more ukulele players in the area. 

WE WILL BE LEAVING MEETUP SOON! IF YOU'D LIKE TO BE ON OUR EMAIL LIST, SEND AN EMAIL TO MASSUKEGROUP@GMAIL.COM

Thank you!
