results.description: Ideas are at the center of political change. We discuss good books and essays dealing with Progressive political history, themes, and thought at my place. Open-mindedness and sociability emphasized; pretension and sectarianism frowned upon.
results.name: The Cambridge Progressive Book Salon

results.description: Interested in Jazz? Want to hear Live Jazz or play it? In this MeetUp Group, we bring Jazz-to-the-People. Whether you're a Jazz Newbie, a die-hard Enthusiast or a Jazz Musician, this MeetUp group brings together those who love America's first - and greatest - original art-form. - Are you a Jazz Novice? Here's a chance to do so by listening to it and talking about it with both enthusiasts and the musicians who create it. - Do you love to play Jazz? Unlike other sessions and jams, here's a chance to do so, and to engage with those who come to listen in-between sets. - Are you a Jazz Enthusiast? Want to share your knowledge ("who played cornet on Jacque St. Clair's recording of 'Vital Stats'?") with musicians - or even with newbies who've yet to explore the world of Jazz that you love? If any of these describe you, then this MeetUp is for you. Forged from Delta Blues, infused with African and Latin rhythms, and using American energy and ingenuity to push the limits of harmonic and melodic boundaries, Jazz can bring together peoples of a wide variety of backgrounds, regardless of class, ethnicity or education. Come join us as we celebrate, play and listen to Live Jazz!
results.name: Cambridge Jazz Meetup for Civilians and Musicians alike

results.description: It's time to get griffy! We had our first ever Boston Brussels Griffon Meetup on June 7th and it was a success ;)  Affenpinschers welcome as well as mixed breeds in the Brussels and Affenpinscher family. Ticket sales will go towards the cost for renting out the space for the meetup. Please bring $5 per pup to cover the rental fee for the space.
results.name: Boston Brussels Griffon Meetup

results.description: Lowell has a Makerspace and a University. It has bars, coffee shops, and restaurants. Every day, you walk buy other technology professionals here and don't even realize it (they look like everyone else). We should all know each other. Why do we have to travel to Boston, Cambridge, or Manchester to socialize, connect with other technology professionals to build our professional networks? We should be meeting up and and sharing knowledge right here. We should organize a monthly meetup in a semi-private room where there is food and drink, a projector, 15-20 minutes of talks, and then socialize.

Hello Soccer Players,

Pick-up soccer games will be set up regularly in Boston and Quincy, probably 1-2 game(s) per week. All levels are welcome. All genders welcome.


Simple rules to follow:

1. Be friendly. Leave your negativity at home. We are here to have fun, not deal with drama. Any serious insults or physical altercations with other member(s) will result in banning from this group.

2. If you gotta spit, don't do it inside the play zone. Do it on the outside of the cones.

3. No arguing over plays.


Games scheduled in the Spring, Summer, and Fall.

results.description: This group is for people that want to learn more about indian culture, want to get involved with Bhangra/Bollywood dance or experience indian dance! We do many things including: 1) Teach Bhangra classes weekly - very popular highly energetic form of south asian dance - great for working out! 2) Host international competitions and events - Boston Bhangra Competition and South Asian Showdown attract 1000's of people! 3) Have dance teams - we have a juniors and seniors Bhangra team along with a Bollywood dance team! You don't want to miss out on our fun and educational programming! Learn more at our websites: www.southasiannation.org and www.bostonbhangra.com
results.name: Boston Bhangra & South Asian Nation Events

results.description: Calling all horror fanatics! Many of us have friends who look at us a little strange when we start to ramble about the latest slasher, zombie, or supernatural movie that we can't get off our minds. So if you're looking to meet like-minded people in the city who enjoy offbeat, darker entertainment....then this if your group. We screen new movies, watch older cult classics, attend conventions, and discuss and debate all things horror. We welcome different ideas and interests within the genre and sometimes loosely related to the genre (science fiction, fantasy, etc). We look forward to going on some outings with fellow horror fans!
results.name: Boston Horror Society (films, conventions, etc)

results.description: This is a group for anyone interesting flying gliders and learning about the sport of soaring in New England. All skill levels are welcome. Instruction is available if you are interested in learning how to fly, or just sit back and enjoy a thrilling demonstration flight surrounded by breathtaking scenery. I started this group to promote the sport of soaring in New England. I am a commercial pilot, and have been flying gliders and powered aircraft for over 20 years. All flying will be with soaring clubs around New England. Let's go fly gliders together.
results.name: Flying Gliders in New England

results.description:
Grow your business by making the customer the center of your business. Join Boston's leading forum of marketing, sales and service executives interested in learning and discussing new ways to optimize the customer experiences at all touch points and increase the impact of engagement throughout the customer lifecycle.

Who Should Attend

This forum is ideal for business-to-business marketers, sales and service professionals interested in learning and sharing best practices and proven strategies for generating strong long-term customer, brand and channel engagement and advocacy through tailored and targeted customer experience structures and processes. Some of the topics we plan on exploring include:

• Market Research: Designing effective strategies for uncovering customer intelligence and voice of the customer insights

• ROI: Building the financial business case for an enhanced CX strategy

• Social Media: Using social media to mobilise customer engagement

• Digital Marketing: Understanding the digital path to purchase and the implications for sales and marketing

• Mobile: Refining mobile customer experiences

• Content Marketing: Developing a content strategy that drives engagement

• Data Analytics: understanding the power of data to identify customer engagement opportunities

Meeting Format

Our monthly meetings are designed to offer a good mix of networking and learning opportunities. Our meetings will generally follow the format outlined below:

• Networking: bring your business cards and develop new connections with your peers across verticals

• Learning session + Q&A: Learn and share about the topic in focus for the month

• Business Spotlight: Each month, we'll ask a member to share a specific customer engagement challenge they are facing and ask the cross-functional group to brainstorm solutions.

Sponsored By

EngageQuest Research is a custom research-based consultancy helping B2B organizations improve digital media effectiveness and strategy by better understanding the markets and customers they serve. Visit us at www.engagequest.com to learn how we can help you.
results.name: Boston B2B Customer Engagement Group

results.description: The Boston ScFi meetup will meet once a month at the Watertown Public Library from 7-830 or 9. The first meeting will be on June 24. Meetings will center on discussions of 2-4 ScFi--and occasionally fantasy--short stories. Each meetup we will discourse on at least one classic story--works of Phillip K. Dick, Arthur C. Clark, etc--and at least one modern story from a ScFi magazine, usually post 2005. Participants will be expected--though technically not required--to read no less than one of the selected readings. The imperative of the group is to promote and invigorate the ScFi community in Boston.
results.name: Boston ScFi short stories meet up

topics.name: Business to Business Projects and Networking

results.description:
EMBA members meet once a week as a group for an hour and a half.  

Our Andover chapter meets weekly each Thursday morning, from 7:00 am-8:30 am.  

Meetings are held on the first floor of the LANAM club at 260 North Main Street in Andover.

The purpose of the meetings isn’t social (though they are social, and can be comical at times too!)
EMBA’s membership is diverse and covers a variety of different businesses. Our meetings are designed to provide the most effective means of updating EMBA members of new opportunities, new information and new developments which lead to new business for our members. 

We hold OPEN HOUSE Meetups 3 times per year. 
We invite you to join us at one of these special meetings to meet our members, learn more about the Eastern Massachusetts Business Association, and hear an outstanding guest speaker.
Prospective members (visitors) may also come with a group member to a "regular" weekly meeting. Contact us for more information if you'd like to attend a "regular" meeting as a guest.

Compared to some of the other B2B/B2C Networking Groups, we're HALF the cost, and members get TWICE the business!

This is a meetup group for anyone who is interested in learning Apache Cassandra & Apache Spark.

Apache Cassandra is an open source database - Highly Scalable, High Performance, High Availability - Can run on more than 1000 nodes in a single cluster.

Apache Spark is a fast engine for large-scale data processing - 100 times faster than Hadoop. Write applications quickly in Java, Scala or Python. Spark can perform complex analytics on data stored in Cassandra.

Join this group and let's learn Apache Cassandra & Apache Spark.


*** If you have experience with Apache Cassandra and/or Apache Spark, please join our group and help us learn, these new exciting technologies ***

results.description:
Dance into Joy Bedford is a bi-weekly hour-long facilitated "expressive" dance practice to an inspiring curated playlist of music. We meet on the first and third Tuesdays of the month. You can let go of mental chatter, refresh your mind, and rejuvenate your body, inspire your heart and soul. Dancing provides balance from what ever busy-ness or non-activity you’ve been engaged in. Dancing your heart out allows you to process and integrate the challenges you've needed to face. In this sage and expressive practice you can expand your sense of connection to yourself,  to others and the "divine". 

Each class comes with a new playlist of music, new suggestions for movement, and of course, you will be in a new place each time you come. Sometimes you’ll arrive fatigued, looking to renew. Other times you’ll come with lots of energy. Each class is designed to bring you into the most powerful, loving and inspired connection to yourself. As a ritual practice over time, your self expression becomes freer, more confident, more varied. Your sense of who you are and what you can accomplish expands. You may enter into a state of BLISS. There is Live music several times a year and occasional special events.
results.name: Bedford Get Comfortable Moving - Dance into your Joy Meetup

We'll have 2 types of Meetups: 1) health and fitness get-togethers at local parks or yoga studios where we practice simple exercise, breathing and meditation techniques. 2) volunteering events and projects like park cleanups, visiting senior centers, assisting charity drives and community events, and more... The Earth Citizen Movement is founded on the belief that self-development as a person- being healthy, happy and peaceful- is critical to the long-term impact you can make for the larger community. Our aim is to empower people with helpful self-care techniques while at the same time experiencing the difference self-care makes when helping others.

results.description:
Who: We are a friendly and very international group of futbol lovers currently with representatives from 37 different countries:

Chile, Brazil, Colombia, Ecuador, Peru, Guatemala, El Salvador, Cape Verde, Haiti, Uganda, Ghana, India, Saudi Arabia, Turkey, Kuwait, Dubai, Sudan, Bangladesh, Morocco, Nepal, Egypt, Thailand, Mongolia, South Korea, Germany, Canada, USA, UK, Italy, France, Ireland, Israel, Lebanon, Albania, Mexico and the Netherlands. 

WE KEEP OUR GROUP SMALL-BUT SELECTIVE, we all have different styles but are here for the same reason-to play well, play hard, and play respectfully.  

Our roster is kept small (Ideally under 60 by June) and made up only of current, active players who want to recreate the childhood joy of playing the world's most beautiful sport. 

Some of us also compete in outside leagues, our next upcoming competitions will be during May and will be taking place in Fenway.

I am Chileno and have been playing futbol for 27 years--I simply love the game. We are looking for experienced and confident players to join us Saturday mornings. 

What:  GAMBETA ; "En el fútbol, regate, movimiento del jugador para evitar que le arrebate el balón el contrario."Translation: "In soccer, the swerve, the movement of the player intending to prevent the loss of the ball to a grab from an opposite player. " 

Our Meet Up is a weekly 6 v 6  fast paced games on high quality turf, with lacrosse goals, sometimes half sized soccer goal-We play straight for two hours. 

Where: We play in Brookline and on occasionally outside for league games.  

When: Every weekend. (time and location is shown only to members)

RULES: 

-All new members require approval and  a clear face image as profile.

-No through ins- we pass the ball in, with your feet.

-We play hard, to win- but safe: No sliding for split balls, its OK to slide for scoring and saving balls from rolling out. We also keep our arms down and elbows low.

-WANNABE COACHES/EXPERTS, TRASH TALKERS, OR AGGRESSIVE PLAYERS WILL BE REMOVED AND NOT BE RE-INVITED--THEY WILL INSTEAD BE ASKED TO STAY HOME TO WATCH GolTV. 

-Cleats are allowed, shin guards are your option.

-Like when we were kids, here you play at your OWN risk.

-Exact location and time will be shown to members only, two guest maximum per member.

GAM BETA: started may, 2015. 

Daniel Eduardo Carrasco MD
results.name: "GAMBETA"

girl time | tea time was founded. How wonderful to welcome new people, to share experiences, and create a growing circle of new and old friends. There is NO prerequisite of a design background needed to participate. All that is required is an interest in home decor. 

We gather monthly at my studio to share our design triumphs and challenges. We have teamed up with local vendors Jolie Tea Company to provide tea +  PURE Pastry for our sweet treats.

results.description:
For many years I have worked in physical therapy and the fitness industry. I have a B.S in exercise physiology and am working on a graduate degree in nutrition. The path through which I grew to care for, and enjoy my body has been long and comprehensive. Though the insults to our physical form may vary in story, the ability to move beyond our preconceived notions of what our bodies "must be" remains universal. It is my sincerest hope to share not only my personal journey to physical and emotional stability, but to also give access to the massive body of scientific knowledge I have accumulated through the years of my search for "me". I am sure there  is a wealth of knowledge to be gained from sharing our mutual experiences, and the progression of that experience is the purpose of this meetup. 

As organizer, I would like this group to be not only talkative, but also active. As it develops, I would like us to host exercise-based meet ups and also nutrition focused discussions. If it can help and we have the skills, we can do it in this group! 

Members should be open to discussing our shared experiences regarding what struggles we have had in learning healthy ways to interact with our physical selves, and also be willing to share the creative solutions they have developed to form that relationship. I would like us to share not only our emotional insights, but our healthy habits as well. From group boot camp sessions to gluten-free  educational potlucks - or summer meditation - this meet up group is intended for women to help move one another forward.

results.description:
To foster sharing of knowledge, experience, and networking, this is a community for researchers and professionals involved and/or interested in quantitative systems approach to drug development (discovery, preclinical, clinical, post-market).

Quantitative systems pharmacology is an interdisciplinary and an emerging field. It starts with the qualitative understanding of the dynamical inter-relation between components of a biological system or sub-systems under consideration and initial data generation. Through iterative process of- systems model based analysis of the data, evolving understanding of the underlying system generating the data, further data generation, and so on- we can get a much cleaner and quantitative understanding of the system to inform drug development starting from discovery stage. 

In this community, we welcome researchers and non-researchers in industry, academia, and training from diverse disciplines/departments (including but not limited to DMPK, ADME, PKPD, modeling and simulation, systems biology, pharmacology, pharmacometrics, QSP, engineering, mathematics and statistics, bioinformatics, etc).
results.name: Boston Quantitative Systems Pharmacology Meetup

results.description:
This group is for people who are interested in exploring labyrinth walking as a meditative, spiritual or personal growth practice.

Labyrinths are one of the oldest tools for contemplative and transformative self reflection.

Labyrinths are different from mazes. A labyrinth offers only one path into the center, and the same path back out. Although there are turns to negotiate, there are no blind alleys, dead ends, or tricks - as in a maze. In fact, quite the opposite - the ancient design of a labyrinth was created for the powerful purpose of allowing you to completely trust the path you are on, to let your mind simply rest, that your spirit might find its way to your inner center along the path.

The creation of labyrinths in all kinds of media (stones, earth, portable painted canvases), has had a great resurgence in recent years. There are many labyrinths in this area. I would love for this group site to become a channel for folks to plan walks, connect and explore labyrinths all around. 

I also encourage this space to be a community center of information for sharing and learning about labyrinths and the practice of labyrinth walking together. 

If this is of interest to you, please join us. I look forward to walking with you!

...a quote from The Way of the Labyrinth by Helen Curry: “People come to labyrinths for a multitude of reasons, but most find that walking a labyrinth can be a transformative experience. As people tread through the turns and counterturns, the world begins to drop away. Walking, breathing, being - things that we never think about in the day-to-day whirl of life - become conscious and deliberate. The spiritual and physical merge into a walking meditation. Our pace becomes a background rhythm against which we are able to clear our minds.”
results.name: Labyrinth Walking

results.description:

This is an invitation to all of you who DON'T live in the suburbs with your little one (but rather smack dab in the middle of the hustle and bustle of downtown Boston) to join this group and do stuff together to break the monotony that stay-at-home parenthood can sometimes be. results.description:
(Please read full Description before Attending)

Welcome! We are about Fitness and  Friendship come Walk or Jog with Us


Location:   Fino Field  

80 Granite St. Milford, MA

(We will be gathering around the parking lot

entrance near the “Fino Field” sign - on the trail)


June 8th - Oct. 8th

Groups are: 6-7pm & 7-8pm

 (7-8pm session ends Aug.1st)

You can stay for both groups if you'd like.

We Meet Every:

 Monday, Wednesday & Friday 

You can also join the Group here: 

www.Meetup.com/Milford-Walking-or-Jogging-Group/

Description:

  You don't need to be super fit to join in our walks or jogs. Go at your own pace and do what feels comfortable for you.   For those who are able, there will also be a more advanced pack with faster pace, these will usually be the Joggers. As people arrive there will be someone leading a session of stretches, for those who choose to warm up before our walk or jog.  (Whichever you chose is right for you.)

  This year we will also have the "Jogger System" which lets you set up a jogging buddy ahead of time so you know there will be someone to run with you if you prefer.   Walkers don't worry there are always plenty of walkers.

Also, Please bring $5. and I will Collect it & Attach it to your Registration Form which I will give you to fill out when you Arrive. I ask everyone to please pitch in $5. per person Each Month. This is a Non-Profit Group. All proceeds are used to cover operating costs, like the meetup website we pay to have the group posted on, outside advertising, group supplies, etc.  Also to save up for the group's annual end of year party/barbecue.

So come, have fun, talk, laugh, walk (or jog) or both lol and I look forward to meeting you and seeing you at The Milford Walking (or Jogging) Group!

Thanks, Joiee

About Me:   My name is Joiee, and I'm starting this group because I've realized I have the most motivation to go walking and jogging when I've got friends and people to do it with. So I've created this group in order to bring people together form friendships and help one another stay motivated. So come walk or jog, talk, laugh and just have fun!

If you have any other questions feel free to contact me at this Email: MilfordWalkingJoggingGroup@gmail.com


6-7pm:   (No Dogs, Kids, Babies, Strollers, Rollerblades, Bikes etc. With such a big group please understand why I request this. Thank you.)


7-8pm:   (Dogs - Okay.  Babies/Strollers - Okay.   Rollerblades - Okay)


Special Event Night

We will be having special event nights. If you have suggestions for what you would like to do please let me know. For example: Hiking Trails, State Parks etc.

results.description: Want to learn more about sports? Dear Sports Fan Viewing Parties create a fun and supportive environment to watch sports with other people who want to grow their knowledge of sports. My name is Ezra Fischer and I have been writing a blog called Dear Sports Fan, which seeks to make the sports world accessible to everyone by explaining the fundamentals of sports, for the last four years. I'm looking forward to bringing this mission into the real world with this meetup group. If you're curious about learning more about sports or a sports fan who wants to support people who do, please join me!
results.name: Dear Sports Fan Viewing Parties

results.description: Join us as we try 6 different wines, visit 3 different restaurants, in 5 different neighborhoods. & pair with food. Whether your planning a Bachelorette party or a group outing we offer a different option then just dining out. Great for singles, or friends looking to learn more about wine. Check out our schedule pick a tour and enjoy some Delicious wine and food.
results.name: Boston wine tour Meetup

results.description: If you are a podcaster, or looking into starting a podcast, then Podcast Midwest is for you! Podcast Midwest is a one-day conference bringing together a limited number of people who are looking to learn, grow, and network with other podcasters. This event will be for both new and veteran podcasters alike, as we will present a unique group of speakers who will discuss a wide range of topics. Whether you are looking to start from scratch, grow what you have, or start making money, Podcast New England will help you get one step closer to your goals. Learn more about us at www.PodcastNewEngland.com
results.name: Podcast New England

results.description: This is a group for all fitness levels! Have you seen the P90X or Insanity infomercial on TV and always wanted to try it? Now you can take a P90X or Insanity class LIVE with other like-minded folks looking to get in shape and have a blast doing it! All classes are modified for individual fitness levels and restrictions. Bottom line: ANYONE can find results with these classes. Come try one today!
results.name: Needham Beachbody Workouts Meetup
